snippet: Advantages in redistricting helped the party hang onto the House despite public disapproval of Congress, but Democrats made modest gains.
abstract: Republicans retain firm hold on House of Representatives, assuring continuation of divided government for at least another two years and attesting to power of gerrymandering over wide public disapproval; Democrats make modest gains, managing to unseat a number of Tea Party-backed freshman.
lead_paragraph: Advantages in redistricting helped the party hang onto the House despite public disapproval of Congress, but Democrats made modest gains.

headline.main: Republicans Retain House by Shoring Up Incumbents
headline.print_headline: Republicans Stand Firm In Controlling the House
